meanings.definition: To carry on or conduct business, negotiations, etc.
meanings.sent1: Every day, the shop owner transacts with customers to sell goods.
meanings.sent2: The company transacts with suppliers to purchase raw materials.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel transacts with the bird for some nuts in exchange for a shiny pebble.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the trees transact with the wind, swaying gently in agreement.
meanings.sent5: The farmer transacts with the land, planting seeds for a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: To carry out or perform (a business transaction, agreement, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She transacts the sale of her car to a new owner.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer transacts the legal documents for the property transfer.
meanings.sent3: The cat transacts the trade of a toy mouse for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The sun transacts its warmth to the earth, bringing life to all living things.
meanings.sent5: The student transacts the exchange of books with a classmate for study purposes.
